results.title: Designing a set
results.creator_credit: Betty Edmonds, Robert Edmonds and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: A glimpse of the various stages of set designing for theatre productions. Beginning with rough sketches from a conference involving the designer, director, technicians and gaffers and concluding with the completion of a set. Shows some of the problems encountered during the process, stressing the need for collaboration between the director and working crew. Two set are developed, an interior and an exterior. Produced in co-operation with Dr. Maurice Gnesin, director of the Goodman Memorial Theatre.

results.title: Designed in Britain
results.creator_credit: J.B. Napier-Bell, Leon Clore and Basic Films
results.brief_description: An impression of British design ranging from furniture, textiles, kitchenware and fine china to buildings and towns. Skilfully edited with minimal commentary and a complementary 50’s soundtrack. Music by Ken Moule; photography by Larry Pizer; edited by Derek York.

results.title: Desalting the seas
results.creator_credit: Stephen Sinichak and Oak Ridge National Laboratory
results.brief_description: Describes the various methods of purifying salt water through the use of nuclear energy, with particular emphasis on nuclear electric desalting plants which produce large amounts of power as well as pure water. Describes the growing shortage of water in a famine-threatened world of expanding population, and ways to combat this.

results.title: Decision for chemistry
results.creator_credit: Sidney Meyers, Monsanto Chemical Company and MPO Productions
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the importance of the chemical industry and its role in everyday living. Mentions the development of fire-resistant materials, treatment of soil with phosphates and Krilium products; the use of detergents in the laundry industry; the development of new textile fibres; and research on radio-active materials. For modern youth, with an enquiring mind, wonderful opportunities for a worth-while career are offered by the chemical industry.

results.title: Dear Theo
results.creator_credit: Jean Beaudin, Paul Larose and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: After a serious car accident, a young woman whose parents are separated and like herself intent on lives of pleasure or business, is placed in a room with a seventy year old lady, who writes to and receives loving letters from her eighty-one year old husband to whom she has been married for nearly fifty years. As time passes the two become warm friends until Josette dies leaving a special gift for Julie who then, passes it on

results.title: A Day in the desert
results.brief_description: Contrary to common opinion the desert supports a profusion of wildlife. Desert flora and fauna all exhibit adaptations to retain, prevent loss of, or derive small amounts of water. In this film specialised survival techniques which permit the withstanding of long periods of drought and extreme temperature changes are studied in the horned toad, badger, peccary, gila woodpecker, various species of desert birds, spiders, snakes and a variety of plants and other animals.

results.title: Dawn flight
results.brief_description: A dramatic story of a young glider pilot. In stunning aerial manoeuvers, tree-top chases, and pursuits through rocky canyons he is haunted by a mysterious super-pilot

results.title: Dates
results.creator_credit: Donovan Miller and Hollywood Film Enterprises
results.brief_description: Date growing in the Coachella Valley of Southern California. Outlines the history of date cultivation in the region; shows artificial pollination, harvesting, grading and packing of the fruit.

results.title: Date with history: Hiroshima
results.brief_description: Shows the preliminary events leading up to the bombing of Hiroshima in August, 1945 in which 72,000 people were killed. some of the people involved are interviewed, giving their reactions to the holocaust. The film contains actual footage of the events.
